protein.specific_function: It may catalyze the formation of the NeuAc-alpha-2,3-Gal-beta-1,3-GalNAc- or NeuAc-alpha-2,3-Gal-beta-1,3-GlcNAc-sequences found in terminal carbohydrate groups of glycoproteins and glycolipids. It may be involved in the biosynthesis of the sialyl Lewis X determinant. Also acts on the corresponding 1,3-galactosyl derivative.

pathway.name: Glycosphingolipid biosynthesis - lacto and neolacto series

reference.reference_text: Kitagawa H, Mattei MG, Paulson JC: Genomic organization and chromosomal mapping of the Gal beta 1,3GalNAc/Gal beta 1,4GlcNAc alpha 2,3-sialyltransferase. J Biol Chem. 1996 Jan 12;271(2):931-8.
Kitagawa H, Paulson JC: Cloning of a novel alpha 2,3-sialyltransferase that sialylates glycoprotein and glycolipid carbohydrate groups. J Biol Chem. 1994 Jan 14;269(2):1394-401.
